H0.text: Collar cells are the specialized cells that sponges have.

H1.text: Tune cells are the specialized cells that sponges have.

H2.text: Magnet cells are the specialized cells that sponges have.

H3.text: Blood cells are the specialized cells that sponges have.

A4.text: Choanocytes (also known as 'collar cells') are cells that line the interior of asconoid, syconoid and leuconoid body types of sponges that contain a central flagellum, or cilium, surrounded by a collar of microvilli which are connected by a thin membrane.

A5.text: By cooperatively moving their flagella, choanocytes filter particles out of the water and into the spongocoel, and out through the osculum.
